question.title: How to Create CRUD Restful WEB SERVICE in JAVA using Eclipse IDE?

node.contents: *"But I didn't found any good tutorial for starting"* Maybe the problem is that you are looking for **one** tutorial that covers all 3, but you need 3 separate tutorial**s**.

astNode.text: *"But I didn't found any good tutorial for starting"* Maybe the problem is that you are looking for **one** tutorial that covers all 3, but you need 3 separate tutorial**s**.

node.contents: Actually I am looking for starting point. Because I get to know about many ways, so I am confused in choosing that. I can use Struts, Spring & also possible Google App Engine and so many more. So which is the best and effective approach to be used.

node.contents: I'd say search 'keyword+tutorial' for keywords MySQL, REST & Eclipse. Voting to close as 'overly broad'.

astNode.text: I'd say search 'keyword+tutorial' for keywords MySQL, REST & Eclipse. Voting to close as 'overly broad'.

node.contents: I am having a database of my project in MySQL. Now I want to create a REST Web Service by using which I am able to get the result in the form of XML/JSON. I done some R&D in that and get to know about JAX-B can be used for this with RESTful service.

astNode.text: I am having a database of my project in MySQL. Now I want to create a REST Web Service by using which I am able to get the result in the form of XML/JSON. I done some R&D in that and get to know about JAX-B can be used for this with RESTful service.

node.contents: Basically I want to create a Web Service as I have developed an app in Android. So what I need is CRUD operation in my Web Service. I need basic tutorials for it. I got many links but that are not very much helpful to me.

astNode.text: Basically I want to create a Web Service as I have developed an app in Android. So what I need is CRUD operation in my Web Service. I need basic tutorials for it. I got many links but that are not very much helpful to me.

node.contents: Can anyone please kindly provide me some basic tutorial link for this.

astNode.text: Can anyone please kindly provide me some basic tutorial link for this.

node.contents: Thanks

node.contents: Here, I tried out one very good example for creating your own RESTful Webservice: Jersey Hello World Example, you may follow the link here: http://www.mkyong.com/webservices/jax-rs/jersey-hello-world-example/

astNode.text: Here, I tried out one very good example for creating your own RESTful Webservice: Jersey Hello World Example, you may follow the link here: http://www.mkyong.com/webservices/jax-rs/jersey-hello-world-example/

node.contents: By the way, you can find the sample code as well at the bottom of that page.

astNode.text: By the way, you can find the sample code as well at the bottom of that page.

node.contents: I have been looking for the same exact tutorial for a while now. Closest I came to was this tutorial here: http://www.techpages.org/webservice/simple-restful-web-services-using-java-and-mysql-example/2009/

astNode.text: I have been looking for the same exact tutorial for a while now. Closest I came to was this tutorial here: http://www.techpages.org/webservice/simple-restful-web-services-using-java-and-mysql-example/2009/

node.contents: It is a pretty simple tutorial however it might be the starting point you need.

astNode.text: It is a pretty simple tutorial however it might be the starting point you need.

node.contents: I have used rest4j for creating a huge RESTful API. It can generate documentation and client libraries for different programming languages. It can also flexibly map your internal Java objects to extends JSON representation. And it is lightweight - no much dependencies and configuration.

astNode.text: I have used rest4j for creating a huge RESTful API. It can generate documentation and client libraries for different programming languages. It can also flexibly map your internal Java objects to extends JSON representation. And it is lightweight - no much dependencies and configuration.

node.contents: I have used Restlet with success before: http://www.restlet.org/

node.contents: Exposing your MySQL database as a RESTful service using java and eclipse can be achieved by using Java EE and the API's it specifies (You can think of Spring as an alternative to Java EE, see What is Spring Framework Built on for more). The API's that can be used for this problem include:

astNode.text: Exposing your MySQL database as a RESTful service using java and eclipse can be achieved by using Java EE and the API's it specifies (You can think of Spring as an alternative to Java EE, see What is Spring Framework Built on for more). The API's that can be used for this problem include:

node.contents:
• Java Architecture for XML Binding (JAXB) for marshalling objects too and from XML/JSON (as you have already discovered).
  • Java Persistence API (JPA), which is a lightweight framework for mapping Plain Old Java Objects (POJOS’s) to database tables.
  • Java API for RESTful Web Services (JAX-RS), which simplifies the creation of RESTful web service by using annotations on POJO's that defines the URI path and the functions that handle HTTP request.

astNode.text:
• Java Architecture for XML Binding (JAXB) for marshalling objects too and from XML/JSON (as you have already discovered).
  • Java Persistence API (JPA), which is a lightweight framework for mapping Plain Old Java Objects (POJOS’s) to database tables.
  • Java API for RESTful Web Services (JAX-RS), which simplifies the creation of RESTful web service by using annotations on POJO's that defines the URI path and the functions that handle HTTP request.

node.contents: The API's defined in the Java EE spec are implemented by Application Servers such as GlassFish, JBoss, WebShere, TomEE etc. (Google App Engine is more than an application server but a platform that offers support for some of the Java EE spec)

astNode.text: The API's defined in the Java EE spec are implemented by Application Servers such as GlassFish, JBoss, WebShere, TomEE etc. (Google App Engine is more than an application server but a platform that offers support for some of the Java EE spec)

node.contents: See the answer I posted for Need to write a RESTful JSON service in Java for a step by step description using the following.

astNode.text: See the answer I posted for Need to write a RESTful JSON service in Java for a step by step description using the following.

node.contents:
• IDE: Eclipse IDE for Jave EE Developers (Kepler), comes with Maven built in
  • Database: MySQL (also makes use of MySQL Workbench)
  • Application Server: GlassFish 4.0
  • Java EE 7 (JAX-RS, JPA, JAXB, etc)
  • Any REST Client for testing: (eg Postman)

astNode.text:
• IDE: Eclipse IDE for Jave EE Developers (Kepler), comes with Maven built in
  • Database: MySQL (also makes use of MySQL Workbench)
  • Application Server: GlassFish 4.0
  • Java EE 7 (JAX-RS, JPA, JAXB, etc)
  • Any REST Client for testing: (eg Postman)
